Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Medusa”
Reviews.Author: Sue K
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our four nights at the Medusa. Our room was spacious, comfortable and very well equipped with a huge bed, lounger, arm chairs, table and chairs overlooking the courtyard, and a well stocked kitchenette. We're glad we splashed out on a grand room -- it was the perfect place to come back to and relax at the end of a busy day holidaying. The hotel was quiet, and the staff very friendly and helpful. The daily papers and pastries were a nice touch. Darlinghurst is a perfect location for exploring Sydney's inner city neighborhoods on foot. 20 minutes walk to downtown, 10 mins to Kings Cross, Paddington, Surrey Hills and Pott's Point. All beautiful neighborhoods with plenty of great eating, drinking, and shopping spots. We'll definitely go back to Medusa.

Reviews.Title: “Love this spot!”
Reviews.Author: SensLarson
Reviews.Content: We visited Sydney after attending a wedding in Manly. We chose the Medusa for its proximity to cafes and restaurants and the price. It was the perfect location and we loved our room. We requested a bath and courtyard view, which happened for us. Luke at the front desk gave us great advice. Lovely place to base yourself in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Vibrant”
Reviews.Author: edwmagee
Reviews.Content: We had the Love Darlo package and it was a lovely place to stay We had room 206 which had a huge balcony overlooking the main street do it was a little noisy butif you closed the windows you barely heard a thing It also had a spa bath on the balcony but it had been turned off as the local bees had made a nest in the outlet pipe but it was being able to sit out and watch the world go past was great Lovely local restaurants the Ecabar wax lovely for breakfast and a few minutes down the road is Phamish a wonderful Vietnamise restaurant Local buses are good but a pass from the news agents the ten trip one is good as more than one person can use it at the same time Also well worth going to Hyde Park Barracks for the convicts tour we had a great free tour with Diana who really made it come alive

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for restaurants and bars”
Reviews.Author: bondilocal
Reviews.Content: Loved the Medusa. Staff were incredibly helpful (even finding me non feather pillows!) but beware the standard rooms are TINY! No clothes drawers or cupboards and definitely not what you would want to hang out in. having said that if your there to go out and explore and only need a comfortable bed and clean room then it's perfect. Being an inner city hotel it was a bit noisy but not overly (and I'm a light sleeper) however it is also a old Victorian terrace so you will hear the doors banging! Internet pictures reflect slightly less tired rooms but for the price we paid ($210) and the location and service I would definitely be back next time I'm going out in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer service”
Reviews.Author: Beardo2504
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel. Hotel staff were really helpful and pleasant. Rooms were clean. Thanks to Luke for taking our Huge bags upto the room!! Would definately recommend to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Really good accommodation for short stays”
Reviews.Author: MickSydney95
Reviews.Content: This place is great - the rooms are modern and clean, the staff are friendly and the location is one of the best in Sydney. My gripe is that, at least in the rooms I have had, there is no place for storing clothes (if you're there for more than 2 days) and no power points. I was there for business and needed somewhere to plug in my lap top and phone but there wasn't anywhere to do so. Not a singe spare power point. That aside though, this is a great and funky hotel and I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in fantastic area”
Reviews.Author: sea98102traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Near a wonderful restaurant area. Also close to Oxford Street and the happenings there. A longer walk to CBD, Opera House, etc. but we did it several times. Staff is very accommodating and knowledgeable of the city and sites, restaurants and venues. Hotel is very clean, very quiet, nicely appointed. We had a room on the second floor in the back. Super quiet and private, though small. But we chose not to spring for a grander room. No complaints other than there is very little closet space and no drawers for clothing or anything. On the plus side there is an economical kitchenette with mini fridge, sink, microwave and bowls, plates, cutlery etc. For a longer stay it's nice to have some foods in the room so you're not only dependent on eating out... even for snacks. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique with the capital "B" !”
Reviews.Author: Ritchy41
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during New Years which is always a very busy period in Sydney. Very warm welcome from Luke and a very nice room. Perfect for a couple. All was very clean, nice bath room, Aveda products and perfect wifi in the room. No facilities at the hotel but you are in Darlinghurst so cafe, restaurants all within minutes walk serving all day breakfast. Location is great. Would definitely return. Staff are all very helpful and friendly. A must go when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “funky in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DebboS
Reviews.Content: We had a weekend at the Medusa & enjoyed almost everything about it. The location & service were the standouts - you can walk to Potts Point, Darlinghurst, Surry Hills, Oxford St, the city, the harbour etc. Great cafes nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in the heart of "Darlo" (Darlinghurst)”
Reviews.Author: Noreen Chan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights recently and loved it. The pink property is easy to spot and has loads of charm and character. The management is welcoming and helpful - Luke was a honey and had many great suggestions for things to do and places to eat - and my room was quiet and well appointed. It is far enough away from the craziness of King's Cross, yet a 15 minute walk takes you to Potts Pint, or down to Hyde Park. A little further - but still walkable, is Paddington. Literally around the corner are pubs, bars, cafes and restaurants to suit every taste. A short stroll takes you to the Sydney Institution Bill's, with its well known all day breakfast. And diagonally opposite is Onde, a French-inspired bistro that has been pacing them in since 1996. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Alternative to a Sydney CBD Stay”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee2603
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights a few weekends ago. The management are just great and create a welcoming, relaxed, atmosphere where you feel a 'part of the place' in an unobtrusive way. Don't be afraid if you are used to staying in large CBD type properties. Yes, it is a small property but offers pretty much everything you need - but with wonderful, friendly service. The management are fine ambassadorsâ€™ for the local area and I don't think there would be any question they could not answer. The room guide - The Silver Book - is full of valuable local information â€“ I have not seen a better room guide that outlines local restaurants / shops etc in any other hotel (and have stayed in rooms all over the world). What these boys don't know about the local area is just not worth worrying about - follow their advice and you will not go wrong. A multitude of fab shops and cafe / restaurantsâ€™ are in the local area and a quick 15 min walk to the centre of CBD (if you really feel the need). I stayed in a Grand Room and it was just perfect - beautiful high ceilings and huge opening windows. Stay just once - I trust you will want to return as soon as possible â€“ I am!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend the Medusa!!”
Reviews.Author: Motbey
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was slightly apprehensive about staying in Darlinghurst given it's close proximity to Kings Cross, however, my fears were unfounded and we ended up having one of the best weekends ever! Starting with the Medusa, this hotel couldn't be in a better spot, opposite a pub and the gorgeous little wine bar/restaurant/cafe Ecabar. The hotel is absolutely charming as are Luke and Jess. We had the good fortune to be upgraded to a "Grand Room" and grand it was! It was well decorated and spotlessly clean. There was no bath, however, that was barely noticeable given the fabulous balcony opening up onto the street complete with table and chairs and even a spa! Once the balcony door closed, the noise from the street disappeared and we were treated to a great night's sleep in the very comfortable king size bed. Luke was very helpful in providing maps and directions to places of interest and was obviously very proud of the area and his hotel. My husband and I celebrated our 20th anniversary here and we are very glad we did. We would highly recommend the Medusa and Darlinghust as a place to stay in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Very well done”
Reviews.Author: YVRReviewer
Reviews.Content: This review has been a long time coming, but the experience that we enjoyed at Medusa was super. We arrived quite early on New Year's Eve, and our room was ready, which is great after a 16 hour flight! The room was very comfortable, good storage space, and I especially liked the built in kitchenette, which made breakfast easy. The bathroom was a bit small, but the Aveda amenities were a nice. The guys who run the place are very friendly, will tell it like it is, and didn't steer us wrong with recommendations, etc. Location is good, and far from tourists, but only 15-20 minute train ride to the harbour, etc. Also, you can actually walk (or jog) to Bondi Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, beautiful & fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Mel_Radelaide
Reviews.Content: This is a little pink hotel nestled on Darlinghurst Road - the managers (owners?) were lovely to deal with and quick to get you to your room and settled with no fuss... AND they more than happily went out of the way to post back my favourite jacket which I left in the room's wardrobe. I asked them just to post it regular mail, but the express-posted it and I had it the next day. Our room was small (I'm sure there were bigger) but the space was used wisely and was very comfortable and private. Great (huge!) shower... And just across the road from great places to grab a drink, dinner or breakfast... we walked everywhere and were perfectly happy with no car. Nice one - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: LondonOzbird
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here and enjoyed every minute. Location means you can walk into the City and to an endless variety of dining drinking and shopping options in Darlinghurst, Surry Hills, Paddington etc. The hotel staff are ace. The hotel also has free access passes to a well equiped gym and an aquatic centre with a 50m pool. Rooms are equiped with kitchenettes (along with comfy beds and Aveda stuff in the bathrooms). Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mfmorgan
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10am, checked in and were taken to our room straightaway. Even our suitcases were carried for us. Clean, comfortable and quirky! We stayed for 6 nights in total, at the height of Mardi Gras and everything was just perfect. Praise for staff member called Luke, who was particularly helpful with info on bars, restaurants and clubs. Would stay there again on our next visit down under.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Sydney Haven”
Reviews.Author: BrookeP24
Reviews.Content: During my honeymoon in Australia I spent several nights at Medusa. It was absolutely wonderful and I highly recommend Medusa to anyone traveling in Sydney. The hotel is not only in a wonderful location close to great shopping, many restaurants, and Sydney nightlife but extremely clean. The entire hotel was perfectly put together and aesthetically pleasing. Our room was spotless and the entire hotel smelled fresh and clean. The bed in our room was AMAZING and we enjoyed the Lindor chocolate that was placed in our room each day. I recommend getting a room facing the fountain in the court yard area because the sounds from the fountain are especially soothing while relaxing in your room. The staff were just as delightful as the hotel itself. Staff were always available to us and they were very knowledgeable about the best attractions and restaurants in Sydney. Each time we left the hotel they gave us directions and suggested the best means of travel for our destination. Medusa made our time in Sydney perfect and we will definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff,makes seeing the Sydney sights a breeze.”
Reviews.Author: AddictedToDiving
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days and loved it. Close to the city, close to Sydney harbour, easy access to Sydney beaches and walking distance to a great selection of dining options. Wife loved it!! Was my first stay but won't be my last. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, but much too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming friendly staff. Hotel well placed if you want to explore the restaurants and nightlife of Darlinghurst and Kings Cross. However, the walls were paper thin and the guests in the room next to me wanted to play loud music and shout and yell for a lot of the night! Also way too much street noise for my liking, even though I asked for (and apparently got) a quiet room!

Reviews.Title: “Service as it ought to be”
Reviews.Author: ScreenName00
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 7am from Europe and was given immediate access to an upgraded room to let me get ready for business meetings that morning. Service was good - friendly and welcoming, and understated without being from the "Hotel Service for Dummies" handbook. Good touches - free ground coffee, pool and gym passes. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Close enough to the city via a walk through Hyde Park. Some nighttime noise from my street facing room, but that is to be expected in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and staff but way too...”
Reviews.Author: Gollielola
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and staff but way too noisy- weekends are a flashback to youth hotel days- loads of young kids sharing rooms and getting trashed, stereo blasting away- v little sleep to be had on my last few visits. Shame really, beautiful building and have stayed often during the last decade since it opened- unfortunately it's let itself go- no more robes or papers at the door, the tv's old and dire- the stereo's work though- no problem there!! They need to remove them or adjust the volume or put a few rules in place.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique elegance - fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: drfi007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a fabulous 2 week holiday in Australia. My sister booked it for us (I would never have chosen it), and I'm glad she did. I tend to go for modern luxurious hotels, with easy access to all the tourist stuff. This hotel is off the beaten track a bit, and it is in a very trendy area (a bit like London's soho!). The only reason for the 4* rating is due to the fact that the hotel is a little out of the way, and the area felt a little dodgy at night. The service was fabulous. The staff were extremely attentive, and the attention to detail was fabulous, from the beautiful toileteries, to the delivery of fresh milk, to the complimentary muffins in the morning. Everywhere smelt incredible too! Every morning of our stay, our host spent about 20 mins with my sister, me and a map and gave us some excellent local tips on where to go and where to eat. Such a nice touch. Made it worth the money (the hotel is certainly not cheap!). There are excellent places to eat nearby. The thai place round the corner was cheap (and BYO!) and as good as any Thai in London. Room wasn't huge, and a little dark, but finished to a very high standard.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel Rocks”
Reviews.Author: NYCHotelGuy
Reviews.Content: This is about my 5th or 6th time stying @ Medusa and have never been disappointed. From the moment you check in you are made to feel welcome by the staff that canâ€™t do enough for you. Being in the Hospitality Industry we can sometimes be very critical of other properties but this place ROCKS. Will be back againâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like you are staying in your own inner city terrace home.”
Reviews.Author: AllanCanberra
Reviews.Content: I was immediately impressed by the service, the decor and the calm ambience when I arrived. I had been trying for a while to stay here, but had until now never been able to secure a reservation. Without a doubt this is a distinctly unique and GAY orientated hotel. Although Sydney accommodation is expensive I don't really think the room was worth more than $200.00 per night (I paid $195.00 on wotif.com.au). Room 292 on the bottom floor adjacent to the courtyard was very small but certainly well maintained. I suspect the bright colorful and large rooms displayed on the website are the more expensive premium rooms. All said I would certainly recomend this property for people who are wanting to avoid run of the mill standard hotel style accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Medusa Love”
Reviews.Author: zr88
Reviews.Content: What a delightful hotel. My husband and I are frequent travellers and we stayed at Medusa recently whilst in Sydney. Not only did we have a beautiful room, comfy bed and friendly service but we were right in the heart of Sydney's restaurant, cafe and bar area and a close walk to Paddington designers. The rooms were fresh and sparkling and my hubby even made me breakfast in bed one morning, thanks to the neat little kitchenette! Lindt chocolates on the pillow were my favourite little touch as well as the Avada toiletries. I just wish we had discovered Medusa sooner!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a mixture”
Reviews.Author: tmg123Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Yes, the bed was wonderfully comfortable and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. But ... the tv didn't work (until someone came and adjusted the aerial), there was no milk in the fridge (I had to go downstairs and ask for it) and no curtains on the window (outside shutters only). I had to wonder who had designed the room - no powerpoint anywhere near the hot water kettle (the only powerpoint was situated about 6 inches from the floor and so the kettle itself had to rest on the floor) and the switch for the lights over the bed was located on the bed frame (I had to be shown - I'd never have found it on my own.) The room was also very small, up a couple of flights of stairs. It reminded me of staying in hotels in Europe. A good location, but I've stayed in much better hotels, at much the same price nearby. The Diamant, for instance.

Reviews.Title: “No worries!”
Reviews.Author: wkeithg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Medusa the first week of December. The room was nice, the staff at the front desk pleasant and helpful. The hotel is very convenient to the King Cross train stop. Of all the places I stayed in Oz, this was the only one that had reasonable prices for broadband Internet ($5 AUD / day). I'd stay there again. The only minor complaint is there were no outlets in the room itself for my laptop, the iron, etc. Ecobar across the street is a good place for a breaky, too. Very nice people.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem.”
Reviews.Author: davidstossel
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful little gem. We had a spare night before a family wedding and so decided to book on a whim. Upon arrival we couldn't have been greeted in a more welcoming manner. We arrived in Sydney very early and they were more than happy to hold onto our luggage whilst we were out and the room was being prepared â€“ they were even kind enough to give us a call when the room was ready. Having known that the hotel was ten years old, we were expecting a little wear and tear - that said though, we were pleasantly surprised. The standard room that we stayed in was a little pokey and probably not the largest room you will get for the price, but the little space that we did have was utilised so well. The decor was very modern/urban and it felt like a lot of time and effort had gone into the design. The Aveda toiletries were a welcome surprise and probably most importantly, the bed was one of the comfiest we had ever slept in. The hotel is located in the heart of Darlinghurst, which is thriving with cool restaurants and bars, all within walking distance. The best of which is Bills, only 100m walk from the hotel â€“ undoubtedly the best scrambled eggs I have ever eaten in my life. Nick or Luke (sorry can not remember) is such an asset to the hotel. Having stayed in many hotels around the world, it is not often that you come across such friendly and welcoming staff as at the Medusa. Next time we are in Sydney we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: pmnoevalley
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Medusa Hotel -- and would definitely return. The staff was great -- friendly, helpful, with lots of insider information on where to go in town. You can't beat the location if you want to experience living in Sydney as opposed to staying in a touristy hotel downtown. The Medusa is within 1-2 blocks of lots of great cafes, restaurants, bars, "bottle" (wine) shops, and a short walk to several of the nicest neighborhoods of Inner East (the nicest part of Sydney). Downtown is a longer (but pleasant) walk or short taxi ride away -- I walked from the hotel to Sydney Harbour and the Opera House twice while I was there. My room was nice -- large bed, free WIFI, huge bathroom, lots of natural light throughout, very clean. Also, there was a small kitchenette inside the wardrobe. Is it the most luxurious place in Sydney? Probably not. But if you're looking for a friendly boutique hotel in a great neighborhood location, I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “what a rip off”
Reviews.Author: bannanacat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the medusa for two nights while in Sydney, what a dissapointment, the place is really not much more than a backpackers that charges five times as much as it claims to be a boutique hotel ! , they have maxed out the number of bedrooms in the property by having nothing else apart from a front desk , ie no bar , lounge , restaurant anything just tiny rooms with paper thin walls Lying in my bed I could clearly hear every word of every conversation in the room next door ..... There is also no parking and the hotel is in a residential area where you need a permit to park so basically if you drive in from the airport you are stuffed with meter parking about 100m away where you constantly have to go every three hours to buy another ticket .....

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Little Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Medusa Hotel during our first trip to Sydney. The hotel was well maintained and the staff very friendly. We stayed in one of the hotel's Grand Rooms which was large, airy and artfully decorated. Located in Darlinghurst, the hotel is still close enough to the main tourist areas (Circular Quay and Opera House)that one can walk to those places. And because we did not stay in the main harbor area, we discovered more of the city on this first visit than we probably would have otherwise. Of course this hotel did not have all the amenities of the larger properties, but for a boutique hotel of its size, the Medusa is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, compact rooms, large service”
Reviews.Author: redcoward
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel between Christmas and New Year 2005. Our room was very compact - the wardrobe housed everything including the kitchen sink: tv, stereo, kettle, microwave, iron, ironing board and even some room for our clothes. However, the cafitere for two and proper coffee was great, as was the lindt chocolates on the pillow every night. The bathroom was bigger with a powerful shower and the aveda products very brillant. The in-room guide was the best I have ever seen - good reviews of the area: restaurants, beaches, etc. However, the best feature of this hotel were the staff! Excellent service and great advice on the area. Also the restaurants in this area were not so touristy and were much cheaper than those on the Rocks etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hugely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Looks great on the web, fantastic pictures. Not so good in real life. We stayed in the Grand Room. Furniture was slightly damaged, TV set was old with faulty sound, cubicle bathroom was small, cold and the toilet was dirty. Kitchenette had full garbage bin, no coffee of any description nor Lindt chocolates (both promised in the advertising). Street noise was at high level most of the night. Morning greeted us with a cockroach running across the room. Hugely overpriced for a special price of $295 a night (normal price about $400). We asked for a refund and received an offer of a free night- we have no intention of taking this offer.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique beauty”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Jules
Reviews.Content: The Medusa is a boutque hotel in Darlinghurst Road. An converted Vcitoria terrace, it oozes character - but without the grunge! Designer decor makes all the difference. Rooms have a great kitchenette area, ideal for those lazy nights or afternoons in. Guests have access to an in-house cd and dvd library. Staff ever so helpful. Recommended for romantic getaways or a holiday in style. Gay and Lesbian friendly - and they even have some rooms where you can have your pooch! look out for great priomotional rates. An ideal location for those wishing to sample inner city Oxford Street, paddington or the Cross. Eca Bar and Fish Face are two wonderful eateries across the road. Kings Cross Station is only a few minutes walk away - so Circualr Quay etc are within easy each.

HotelInfo.Name: Medusa
HotelInfo.Address: 267 Darlinghurst Road | Darlinghurst, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia
